metadata.title: CVE-2014-125022 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg 2.0. It has been classified asproblematic. Affected is the function shorten_decode_frame of the componentBitstream Buffer. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. It ispossible to launch the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply a patchto fix this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libav-tools - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.6-1ubuntu2').
